verses.name: 1 Clement 1:1
verses.text: Chapter I.

verses.name: 1 Clement 1:2
verses.text: —The Salutation.

verses.name: 1 Clement 1:3
verses.text: Praise of the Corinthians Before the Breaking Forth of Schism Among Them.

verses.name: 1 Clement 1:4
verses.text: The church of God which sojourns at Rome, to the church of God sojourning at Corinth, to them that are called and sanctified by the will of God, through our Lord Jesus Christ: Grace unto you, and peace, from Almighty God through Jesus Christ, be multiplied.

verses.name: 1 Clement 1:5
verses.text: Owing, dear brethren, to the sudden and successive calamitous events which have happened to ourselves, we feel that we have been somewhat tardy in turning our attention to the points respecting which you consulted us; and especially to that shameful and detestable sedition, utterly abhorrent to the elect of God, which a few rash and self-confident persons have kindled to such a pitch of frenzy, that your venerable and illustrious name, worthy to be universally loved, has suffered grievous injury.

verses.name: 1 Clement 1:6
verses.text: For who ever dwelt even for a short time among you, and did not find your faith to be as fruitful of virtue as it was firmly established? Who did not admire the sobriety and moderation of your godliness in Christ? Who did not proclaim the magnificence of your habitual hospitality? And who did not rejoice over your perfect and well-grounded knowledge? For ye did all things without respect of persons, and walked in the commandments of God, being obedient to those who had the rule over you, and giving all fitting honour to the presbyters among you.

verses.name: 1 Clement 1:7
verses.text: Ye enjoined young men to be of a sober and serious mind, ye instructed your wives to do all things with a blameless, becoming, and pure conscience, loving their husbands as in duty bound; and ye taught them that, living in the rule of obedience, they should manage their household affairs becomingly, and be in every respect marked by discretion.

verses.name: 1 Clement 2:1
verses.text: Chapter II.

verses.name: 1 Clement 2:2
verses.text: —Praise of the Corinthians Continued.

verses.name: 1 Clement 2:3
verses.text: Moreover, ye were all distinguished by humility, and were in no respect puffed up with pride, but yielded obedience rather than extorted it, and were more willing to give than to receive.

verses.name: 1 Clement 2:4
verses.text: Content with the provision which God had made for you, and carefully attending to His words, ye were inwardly filled with His doctrine, and His sufferings were before your eyes.

verses.name: 1 Clement 2:5
verses.text: Thus a profound and abundant peace was given to you all, and ye had an insatiable desire for doing good, while a full outpouring of the Holy Spirit was upon you all.

verses.name: 1 Clement 2:6
verses.text: Full of holy designs, ye did, with true earnestness of mind and a godly confidence, stretch forth your hands to God Almighty, beseeching Him to be merciful unto you, if ye had been guilty of any involuntary transgression.

verses.name: 1 Clement 2:7
verses.text: Day and night ye were anxious for the whole brotherhood, that the number of God's elect might be saved with mercy and a good conscience.

verses.name: 1 Clement 2:8
verses.text: Ye were sincere and uncorrupted, and forgetful of injuries between one another.

verses.name: 1 Clement 2:9
verses.text: Every kind of faction and schism was abominable in your sight.

verses.name: 1 Clement 2:10
verses.text: Ye mourned over the transgressions of your neighbours: their deficiencies you deemed your own.

verses.name: 1 Clement 2:11
verses.text: Ye never grudged any act of kindness, being "ready to every good work".

verses.name: 1 Clement 2:12
verses.text: Adorned by a thoroughly virtuous and religious life, ye did all things in the fear of God.

verses.name: 1 Clement 2:13
verses.text: The commandments and ordinances of the Lord were written upon the tablets of your hearts.

verses.name: 1 Clement 3:1
verses.text: Chapter III.

verses.name: 1 Clement 3:2
verses.text: —The Sad State of the Corinthian Church After Sedition Arose in It from Envy and Emulation.

verses.name: 1 Clement 3:3
verses.text: Every kind of honour and happiness was bestowed upon you, and then was fulfilled that which is written, "My beloved did eat and drink, and was enlarged and became fat, and kicked".

verses.name: 1 Clement 3:4
verses.text: Hence flowed emulation and envy, strife and sedition, persecution and disorder, war and captivity.

verses.name: 1 Clement 3:5
verses.text: So the worthless rose up against the honoured, those of no reputation against such as were renowned, the foolish against the wise, the young against those advanced in years.

verses.name: 1 Clement 3:6
verses.text: For this reason righteousness and peace are now far departed from you, inasmuch as every one abandons the fear of God, and is become blind in His faith, neither walks in the ordinances of His appointment, nor acts a part becoming a Christian, but walks after his own wicked lusts, resuming the practice of an unrighteous and ungodly envy, by which death itself entered into the world.

verses.name: 1 Clement 4:1
verses.text: Chapter IV.

verses.name: 1 Clement 4:2
verses.text: —Many Evils Have Already Flowed from This Source in Ancient Times.

verses.name: 1 Clement 4:3
verses.text: For thus it is written: "And it came to pass after certain days, that Cain brought of the fruits of the earth a sacrifice unto God; and Abel also brought of the firstlings of his sheep, and of the fat thereof.

verses.name: 1 Clement 4:4
verses.text: And God had respect to Abel and to his offerings, but Cain and his sacrifices He did not regard.

verses.name: 1 Clement 4:5
verses.text: And Cain was deeply grieved, and his countenance fell.

verses.name: 1 Clement 4:6
verses.text: And God said to Cain, Why art thou grieved, and why is thy countenance fallen? If thou offerest rightly, but dost not divide rightly, hast thou not sinned? Be at peace: thine offering returns to thyself, and thou shalt again possess it.

verses.name: 1 Clement 4:7
verses.text: And Cain said to Abel his brother, Let us go into the field.

verses.name: 1 Clement 4:8
verses.text: And it came to pass, while they were in the field, that Cain rose up against Abel his brother, and slew him".

verses.name: 1 Clement 4:9
verses.text: Ye see, brethren, how envy and jealousy led to the murder of a brother.

verses.name: 1 Clement 4:10
verses.text: Through envy, also, our father Jacob fled from the face of Esau his brother.

verses.name: 1 Clement 4:11
verses.text: Envy made Joseph be persecuted unto death, and to come into bondage.

verses.name: 1 Clement 4:12
verses.text: Envy compelled Moses to flee from the face of Pharaoh king of Egypt, when he heard these words from his fellow-countryman, "Who made thee a judge or a ruler over us? Wilt thou kill me, as thou didst kill the Egyptian yesterday?" On account of envy, Aaron and Miriam had to make their abode without the camp.

verses.name: 1 Clement 4:13
verses.text: Envy brought down Dathan and Abiram alive to Hades, through the sedition which they excited against God's servant Moses.

verses.name: 1 Clement 4:14
verses.text: Through envy, David not only underwent the hatred of foreigners, but was also persecuted by Saul king of Israel.

verses.name: 1 Clement 5:1
verses.text: Chapter V.

verses.name: 1 Clement 5:2
verses.text: —No Less Evils Have Arisen from the Same Source in the Most Recent Times.

verses.name: 1 Clement 5:3
verses.text: The Martyrdom of Peter and Paul.

verses.name: 1 Clement 5:4
verses.text: But not to dwell upon ancient examples, let us come to the most recent spiritual heroes.

verses.name: 1 Clement 5:5
verses.text: Let us take the noble examples furnished in our own generation.

verses.name: 1 Clement 5:6
verses.text: Through envy and jealousy the greatest and most righteous pillars of the church have been persecuted and put to death.

verses.name: 1 Clement 5:7
verses.text: Let us set before our eyes the illustrious apostles.

verses.name: 1 Clement 5:8
verses.text: Peter, through unrighteous envy, endured not one or two, but numerous labours; and when he had at length suffered martyrdom, departed to the place of glory due to him.

verses.name: 1 Clement 5:9
verses.text: Owing to envy, Paul also obtained the reward of patient endurance, after being seven times thrown into captivity, compelled to flee, and stoned.

verses.name: 1 Clement 5:10
verses.text: After preaching both in the east and west, he gained the illustrious reputation due to his faith, having taught righteousness to the whole world, and come to the extreme limit of the west, and suffered martyrdom under the prefects.

verses.name: 1 Clement 5:11
verses.text: Thus was he removed from the world, and went into the holy place, having proved himself a striking example of patience.

verses.name: 1 Clement 6:1
verses.text: Chapter VI.

verses.name: 1 Clement 6:2
verses.text: —Continuation.

verses.name: 1 Clement 6:3
verses.text: Several Other Martyrs.

verses.name: 1 Clement 6:4
verses.text: To these men who spent their lives in the practice of holiness, there is to be added a great multitude of the elect, who, having through envy endured many indignities and tortures, furnished us with a most excellent example.

verses.name: 1 Clement 6:5
verses.text: Through envy, those women, the Danaids and Dircae, being persecuted, after they had suffered terrible and unspeakable torments, finished the course of their faith with stedfastness, and though weak in body, received a noble reward.

verses.name: 1 Clement 6:6
verses.text: Envy has alienated wives from their husbands, and changed that saying of our father Adam, "This is now bone of my bones, and flesh of my flesh".

verses.name: 1 Clement 6:7
verses.text: Envy and strife have overthrown great cities, and rooted up mighty nations.

verses.name: 1 Clement 7:1
verses.text: Chapter VII.

verses.name: 1 Clement 7:2
verses.text: —An Exhortation to Repentance.

verses.name: 1 Clement 7:3
verses.text: These things, beloved, we write unto you, not merely to admonish you of your duty, but also to remind ourselves.

verses.name: 1 Clement 7:4
verses.text: For we are struggling on the same arena, and the same conflict is assigned to both of us.

verses.name: 1 Clement 7:5
verses.text: Wherefore let us give up vain and fruitless cares, and approach to the glorious and venerable rule of our holy calling.

verses.name: 1 Clement 7:6
verses.text: Let us attend to what is good, pleasing, and acceptable in the sight of Him who formed us.

verses.name: 1 Clement 7:7
verses.text: Let us look stedfastly to the blood of Christ, and see how precious that blood is to God which, having been shed for our salvation, has set the grace of repentance before the whole world.

verses.name: 1 Clement 7:8
verses.text: Let us turn to every age that has passed, and learn that, from generation to generation, the Lord has granted a place of repentance to all such as would be converted unto Him.

verses.name: 1 Clement 7:9
verses.text: Noah preached repentance, and as many as listened to him were saved.

verses.name: 1 Clement 7:10
verses.text: Jonah proclaimed destruction to the Ninevites; but they, repenting of their sins, propitiated God by prayer, and obtained salvation, although they were aliens to the covenant of God.

verses.name: 1 Clement 8:1
verses.text: Chapter VIII.

verses.name: 1 Clement 8:2
verses.text: —Continuation Respecting Repentance.

verses.name: 1 Clement 8:3
verses.text: The ministers of the grace of God have, by the Holy Spirit, spoken of repentance; and the Lord of all things has himself declared with an oath regarding it, "As I live, saith the Lord, I desire not the death of the sinner, but rather his repentance;" adding, moreover, this gracious declaration, "Repent, O house of Israel, of your iniquity".

verses.name: 1 Clement 8:4
verses.text: Say to the children of my people, Though your sins reach from earth to heaven, and though they be redder than scarlet, and blacker than sack-cloth, yet if ye turn to me with your whole heart, and say, Father! I will listen to you, as to a holy people.

verses.name: 1 Clement 8:5
verses.text: And in another place He speaks thus: "Wash you and become clean; put away the wickedness of your souls from before mine eyes; cease from your evil ways, and learn to do well; seek out judgment, deliver the oppressed, judge the fatherless, and see that justice is done to the widow; and come, and let us reason together.

verses.name: 1 Clement 8:6
verses.text: He declares, Though your sins be like crimson, I will make them white as snow; though they be like scarlet, I will whiten them like wool.

verses.name: 1 Clement 8:7
verses.text: And if ye be willing and obey me, ye shall eat the good of the land; but if ye refuse, and will not hearken unto me, the sword shall devour you, for the mouth of the Lord hath spoken these things".

verses.name: 1 Clement 8:8
verses.text: Desiring, therefore, that all His beloved should be partakers of repentance, He has, by His almighty will, established these declarations.

verses.name: 1 Clement 9:1
verses.text: Chapter IX.

verses.name: 1 Clement 9:2
verses.text: —Examples of the Saints.

verses.name: 1 Clement 9:3
verses.text: Wherefore, let us yield obedience to His excellent and glorious will; and imploring His mercy and loving-kindness, while we forsake all fruitless labours and strife, and envy, which leads to death, let us turn and have recourse to His compassions.

verses.name: 1 Clement 9:4
verses.text: Let us stedfastly contemplate those who have perfectly ministered to his excellent glory.

verses.name: 1 Clement 9:5
verses.text: Let us take (for instance) Enoch, who, being found righteous in obedience, was translated, and death was never known to happen to him.

verses.name: 1 Clement 9:6
verses.text: Noah, being found faithful, preached regeneration to the world through his ministry; and the Lord saved by him the animals which, with one accord, entered into the ark.

verses.name: 1 Clement 10:1
verses.text: Chapter X.

verses.name: 1 Clement 10:2
verses.text: —Continuation of the Above.

verses.name: 1 Clement 10:3
verses.text: Abraham, styled "the friend," was found faithful, inasmuch as he rendered obedience to the words of God.

verses.name: 1 Clement 10:4
verses.text: He, in the exercise of obedience, went out from his own country, and from his kindred, and from his father's house, in order that, by forsaking a small territory, and a weak family, and an insignificant house, he might inherit the promises of God.

verses.name: 1 Clement 10:5
verses.text: For God said to him, "Get thee out from thy country, and from thy kindred, and from thy father's house, into the land which I shall show thee.

verses.name: 1 Clement 10:6
verses.text: And I will make thee a great nation, and will bless thee, and make thy name great, and thou shalt be blessed.

verses.name: 1 Clement 10:7
verses.text: And I will bless them that bless thee, and curse them that curse thee; and in thee shall all the families of the earth be blessed".

verses.name: 1 Clement 10:8
verses.text: And again, on his departing from Lot, God said to him, "Lift up thine eyes, and look from the place where thou now art, northward, and southward, and eastward, and westward; for all the land which thou seest, to thee will I give it, and to thy seed for ever.

verses.name: 1 Clement 10:9
verses.text: And I will make thy seed as the dust of the earth, so that if a man can number the dust of the earth, then shall thy seed also be numbered".

verses.name: 1 Clement 10:10
verses.text: And again the Scripture saith, "God brought forth Abram, and spake unto him, Look up now to heaven, and count the stars if thou be able to number them; so shall thy seed be.

verses.name: 1 Clement 10:11
verses.text: And Abram believed God, and it was counted to him for righteousness".

verses.name: 1 Clement 10:12
verses.text: On account of his faith and hospitality, a son was given him in his old age; and in the exercise of obedience, he offered him as a sacrifice to God on one of the mountains which He showed him.

verses.name: 1 Clement 11:1
verses.text: Chapter XI.

verses.name: 1 Clement 11:2
verses.text: —Continuation.

verses.name: 1 Clement 11:3
verses.text: Lot.

verses.name: 1 Clement 11:4
verses.text: On account of his hospitality and godliness, Lot was saved out of Sodom when all the country round was punished by means of fire and brimstone, the Lord thus making it manifest that He does not forsake those that hope in Him, but gives up such as depart from Him to punishment and torture.

verses.name: 1 Clement 11:5
verses.text: For Lot's wife, who went forth with him, being of a different mind from himself, and not continuing in agreement with him as to the command which had been given them, was made an example of, so as to be a pillar of salt unto this day.

verses.name: 1 Clement 11:6
verses.text: This was done that all might know that those who are of a double mind, and who distrust the power of God, bring down judgment on themselves and become a sign to all succeeding generations.

verses.name: 1 Clement 12:1
verses.text: Chapter XII.

verses.name: 1 Clement 12:2
verses.text: —The Rewards of Faith and Hospitality.

verses.name: 1 Clement 12:3
verses.text: Rahab.

verses.name: 1 Clement 12:4
verses.text: On account of her faith and hospitality, Rahab the harlot was saved.

verses.name: 1 Clement 12:5
verses.text: For when spies were sent by Joshua, the son of Nun, to Jericho, the king of the country ascertained that they were come to spy out their land, and sent men to seize them, in order that, when taken, they might be put to death.

verses.name: 1 Clement 12:6
verses.text: But the hospitable Rahab receiving them, concealed them on the roof of her house under some stalks of flax.

verses.name: 1 Clement 12:7
verses.text: And when the men sent by the king arrived and said, "There came men unto thee who are to spy out our land; bring them forth, for so the king commands," she answered them, "The two men whom ye seek came unto me, but quickly departed again and are gone," thus not discovering the spies to them.

verses.name: 1 Clement 12:8
verses.text: Then she said to the men, "I know assuredly that the Lord your God hath given you this city, for the fear and dread of you have fallen on its inhabitants.

verses.name: 1 Clement 12:9
verses.text: When therefore ye shall have taken it, keep ye me and the house of my father in safety".

verses.name: 1 Clement 12:10
verses.text: And they said to her, "It shall be as thou hast spoken to us.

verses.name: 1 Clement 12:11
verses.text: As soon, therefore, as thou knowest that we are at hand, thou shalt gather all thy family under thy roof, and they shall be preserved, but all that are found outside of thy dwelling shall perish".

verses.name: 1 Clement 12:12
verses.text: Moreover, they gave her a sign to this effect, that she should hang forth from her house a scarlet thread.

verses.name: 1 Clement 12:13
verses.text: And thus they made it manifest that redemption should flow through the blood of the Lord to all them that believe and hope in God.

verses.name: 1 Clement 12:14
verses.text: Ye see, beloved, that there was not only faith, but prophecy, in this woman.

verses.name: 1 Clement 13:1
verses.text: Chapter XIII.

verses.name: 1 Clement 13:2
verses.text: —An Exhortation to Humility.

verses.name: 1 Clement 13:3
verses.text: Let us therefore, brethren, be of humble mind, laying aside all haughtiness, and pride, and foolishness, and angry feelings; and let us act according to that which is written (for the Holy Spirit saith, "Let not the wise man glory in his wisdom, neither let the mighty man glory in his might, neither let the rich man glory in his riches; but let him that glorieth glory in the Lord, in diligently seeking Him, and doing judgment and righteousness"), being especially mindful of the words of the Lord Jesus which He spake teaching us meekness and long-suffering.

verses.name: 1 Clement 13:4
verses.text: For thus He spoke: "Be ye merciful, that ye may obtain mercy; forgive, that it may be forgiven to you; as ye do, so shall it be done unto you; as ye judge, so shall ye be judged; as ye are kind, so shall kindness be shown to you; with what measure ye mete, with the same it shall be measured to you".

verses.name: 1 Clement 13:5
verses.text: By this precept and by these rules let us stablish ourselves, that we walk with all humility in obedience to His holy words.

verses.name: 1 Clement 13:6
verses.text: For the holy word saith, "On whom shall I look, but on him that is meek and peaceable, and that trembleth at my words?".

verses.name: 1 Clement 14:1
verses.text: Chapter XIV.

verses.name: 1 Clement 14:2
verses.text: —We Should Obey God Rather Than the Authors of Sedition.

verses.name: 1 Clement 14:3
verses.text: It is right and holy therefore, men and brethren, rather to obey God than to follow those who, through pride and sedition, have become the leaders of a detestable emulation.

verses.name: 1 Clement 14:4
verses.text: For we shall incur no slight injury, but rather great danger, if we rashly yield ourselves to the inclinations of men who aim at exciting strife and tumults, so as to draw us away from what is good.

verses.name: 1 Clement 14:5
verses.text: Let us be kind one to another after the pattern of the tender mercy and benignity of our Creator.

verses.name: 1 Clement 14:6
verses.text: For it is written, "The kind-hearted shall inhabit the land, and the guiltless shall be left upon it, but transgressors shall be destroyed from off the face of it".

verses.name: 1 Clement 14:7
verses.text: And again the Scripture saith, "I saw the ungodly highly exalted, and lifted up like the cedars of Lebanon: I passed by, and, behold, he was not; and I diligently sought his place, and could not find it.

verses.name: 1 Clement 14:8
verses.text: Preserve innocence, and look on equity: for there shall be a remnant to the peaceable man".

verses.name: 1 Clement 15:1
verses.text: Chapter XV.

verses.name: 1 Clement 15:2
verses.text: —We Must Adhere to Those Who Cultivate Peace, Not to Those Who Merely Pretend to Do So.

verses.name: 1 Clement 15:3
verses.text: Let us cleave, therefore, to those who cultivate peace with godliness, and not to those who hypocritically profess to desire it.

verses.name: 1 Clement 15:4
verses.text: For the Scripture saith in a certain place, "This people honoureth me with their lips, but their heart is far from me".

verses.name: 1 Clement 15:5
verses.text: And again: "They bless with their mouth, but curse with their heart".

verses.name: 1 Clement 15:6
verses.text: And again it saith, "They loved Him with their month, and lied to Him with their tongue; but their heart was not right with Him, neither were they faithful in His covenant".

verses.name: 1 Clement 15:7
verses.text: "Let the deceitful lips become silent, and "let the Lord destroy all the lying lips, and the boastful tongue of those who have said, Let us magnify our tongue: our lips are our own; who is lord over us? For the oppression of the poor, and for the sighing of the needy, will I now arise, saith the Lord: I will place him in safety; I will deal confidently with him".

verses.name: 1 Clement 16:1
verses.text: Chapter XVI.

verses.name: 1 Clement 16:2
verses.text: —Christ as an Example of Humility.

verses.name: 1 Clement 16:3
verses.text: For Christ is of those who are humble-minded, and not of those who exalt themselves over His flock.

verses.name: 1 Clement 16:4
verses.text: Our Lord Jesus Christ, the Sceptre of the majesty of God, did not come in the pomp of pride or arrogance, although He might have done so, but in a lowly condition, as the Holy Spirit had declared regarding Him.

verses.name: 1 Clement 16:5
verses.text: For He says, "Lord, who hath believed our report, and to whom is the arm of the Lord revealed? We have declared our message in His presence: He is, as it were, a child, and like a root in thirsty ground; He has no form nor glory, yea, we saw Him, and He had no form nor comeliness; but His form was without eminence, yea, deficient in comparison with the ordinary form of men.

verses.name: 1 Clement 16:6
verses.text: He is a man exposed to stripes and suffering, and acquainted with the endurance of grief: for His countenance was turned away; He was despised, and not esteemed.

verses.name: 1 Clement 16:7
verses.text: He bears our iniquities, and is in sorrow for our sakes; yet we supposed that on His own account He was exposed to labour, and stripes, and affliction.

verses.name: 1 Clement 16:8
verses.text: But He was wounded for our transgressions, and bruised for our iniquities.

verses.name: 1 Clement 16:9
verses.text: The chastisement of our peace was upon Him, and by His stripes we were healed.

verses.name: 1 Clement 16:10
verses.text: All we, like sheep, have gone astray; every man has wandered in his own way; and the Lord has delivered Him up for our sins, while He in the midst of His sufferings openeth not His mouth.

verses.name: 1 Clement 16:11
verses.text: He was brought as a sheep to the slaughter, and as a lamb before her shearer is dumb, so He openeth not His mouth.

verses.name: 1 Clement 16:12
verses.text: In His humiliation His judgment was taken away; who shall declare His generation? for His life is taken from the earth.

verses.name: 1 Clement 16:13
verses.text: For the transgressions of my people was He brought down to death.

verses.name: 1 Clement 16:14
verses.text: And I will give the wicked for His sepulchre, and the rich for His death, because He did no iniquity, neither was guile found in His mouth.

verses.name: 1 Clement 16:15
verses.text: And the Lord is pleased to purify him by stripes.

verses.name: 1 Clement 16:16
verses.text: If ye make an offering for sin, your soul shall see a long-lived seed.

verses.name: 1 Clement 16:17
verses.text: And the Lord is pleased to relieve Him of the affliction of His soul, to show Him light, and to form Him with understanding, to justify the Just One who ministereth well to many; and He Himself shall carry their sins.

verses.name: 1 Clement 16:18
verses.text: On this account He shall inherit many, and shall divide the spoil of the strong; because His soul was delivered to death, and He was reckoned among the transgressors, and He bare the sins of many, and for their sins was He delivered".

verses.name: 1 Clement 16:19
verses.text: And again He saith, "I am a worm, and no man; a reproach of men, and despised of the people.

verses.name: 1 Clement 16:20
verses.text: All that see me have derided me; they have spoken with their lips; they have wagged their head, saying He hoped in God, let Him deliver Him, let Him save Him, since He delighteth in Him".

verses.name: 1 Clement 16:21
verses.text: Ye see, beloved, what is the example which has been given us; for if the Lord thus humbled Himself, what shall we do who have through Him come under the yoke of His grace?.

verses.name: 1 Clement 17:1
verses.text: Chapter XVII.

verses.name: 1 Clement 17:2
verses.text: —The Saints as Examples of Humility.

verses.name: 1 Clement 17:3
verses.text: Let us be imitators also of those who in goat-skins and sheep-skins went about proclaiming the coming of Christ; I mean Elijah, Elisha, and Ezekiel among the prophets, with those others to whom a like testimony is borne in Scripture.

verses.name: 1 Clement 17:4
verses.text: Abraham was specially honoured, and was called the friend of God; yet he, earnestly regarding the glory of God, humbly declared, "I am but dust and ashes".

verses.name: 1 Clement 17:5
verses.text: Moreover, it is thus written of Job, "Job was a righteous man, and blameless, truthful, God-fearing, and one that kept himself from all evil".

verses.name: 1 Clement 17:6
verses.text: But bringing an accusation against himself, he said, "No man is free from defilement, even if his life be but of one day".

verses.name: 1 Clement 17:7
verses.text: Moses was called faithful in all God's house; and through his instrumentality, God punished Egypt with plagues and tortures.

verses.name: 1 Clement 17:8
verses.text: Yet he, though thus greatly honoured, did not adopt lofty language, but said, when the divine oracle came to him out of the bush, "Who am I, that Thou sendest me? I am a man of a feeble voice and a slow tongue".

verses.name: 1 Clement 17:9
verses.text: And again he said, "I am but as the smoke of a pot".

verses.name: 1 Clement 18:1
verses.text: Chapter XVIII.

verses.name: 1 Clement 18:2
verses.text: —David as an Example of Humility.

verses.name: 1 Clement 18:3
verses.text: But what shall we say concerning David, to whom such testimony was borne, and of whom God said, "I have found a man after mine own heart, David the son of Jesse; and in everlasting mercy have I anointed him?" Yet this very man saith to God, "Have mercy on me, O Lord, according to Thy great mercy; and according to the multitude of Thy compassions, blot out my transgression.

verses.name: 1 Clement 18:4
verses.text: Wash me still more from mine iniquity, and cleanse me from my sin.

verses.name: 1 Clement 18:5
verses.text: For I acknowledge mine iniquity, and my sin is ever before me.

verses.name: 1 Clement 18:6
verses.text: Against Thee only have I sinned, and done that which is evil in Thy sight; that Thou mayest be justified in Thy sayings, and mayest overcome when Thou art judged.

verses.name: 1 Clement 18:7
verses.text: For, behold, I was conceived in transgressions, and in sins did my mother conceive me.

verses.name: 1 Clement 18:8
verses.text: For, behold, Thou hast loved truth; the secret and hidden things of wisdom hast Thou shown me.

verses.name: 1 Clement 18:9
verses.text: Thou shalt sprinkle me with hyssop, and I shall be cleansed; Thou shalt wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.

verses.name: 1 Clement 18:10
verses.text: Thou shalt make me to hear joy and gladness; my bones, which have been humbled, shall exult.

verses.name: 1 Clement 18:11
verses.text: Turn away Thy face from my sins, and blot out all mine iniquities.

verses.name: 1 Clement 18:12
verses.text: Create in me a clean heart, O God, and renew a right spirit within me.

verses.name: 1 Clement 18:13
verses.text: Cast me not away from Thy presence, and take not Thy Holy Spirit from me.

verses.name: 1 Clement 18:14
verses.text: Restore to me the joy of Thy salvation, and establish me by Thy governing Spirit.

verses.name: 1 Clement 18:15
verses.text: I will teach transgressors Thy ways, and the ungodly shall be converted unto Thee.

verses.name: 1 Clement 18:16
verses.text: Deliver me from blood-guiltiness, O God, the God of my salvation: my tongue shall exult in Thy righteousness.

verses.name: 1 Clement 18:17
verses.text: O Lord, Thou shalt open my mouth, and my lips shall show forth Thy praise.

verses.name: 1 Clement 18:18
verses.text: For if Thou hadst desired sacrifice, I would have given it; Thou wilt not delight in burnt-offerings.

verses.name: 1 Clement 18:19
verses.text: The sacrifice acceptable to God is a bruised spirit; a broken and a contrite heart God will not despise".

verses.name: 1 Clement 19:1
verses.text: Chapter XIX.

verses.name: 1 Clement 19:2
verses.text: —Imitating These Examples, Let Us Seek After Peace.

verses.name: 1 Clement 19:3
verses.text: Thus the humility and godly submission of so great and illustrious men have rendered not only us, but also all the generations before us, better; even as many as have received His oracles in fear and truth.

verses.name: 1 Clement 19:4
verses.text: Wherefore, having so many great and glorious examples set before us, let us turn again to the practice of that peace which from the beginning was the mark set before us; and let us look stedfastly to the Father and Creator of the universe, and cleave to His mighty and surpassingly great gifts and benefactions of peace.

verses.name: 1 Clement 19:5
verses.text: Let us contemplate Him with our understanding, and look with the eyes of our soul to His long-suffering will.

verses.name: 1 Clement 19:6
verses.text: Let us reflect how free from the wrath He is towards all His creation.

verses.name: 1 Clement 20:1
verses.text: Chapter XX.

verses.name: 1 Clement 20:2
verses.text: —The Peace and Harmony of the Universe.

verses.name: 1 Clement 20:3
verses.text: The heavens, revolving under His government, are subject to Him in peace.

verses.name: 1 Clement 20:4
verses.text: Day and night run the course appointed by Him, in no wise hindering each other.

verses.name: 1 Clement 20:5
verses.text: The sun and moon, with the companies of the stars, roll on in harmony according to His command, within their prescribed limits, and without any deviation.

verses.name: 1 Clement 20:6
verses.text: The fruitful earth, according to His will, brings forth food in abundance, at the proper seasons, for man and beast and all the living beings upon it, never hesitating, nor changing any of the ordinances which He has fixed.

verses.name: 1 Clement 20:7
verses.text: The unsearchable places of abysses, and the indescribable arrangements of the lower world, are restrained by the same laws.

verses.name: 1 Clement 20:8
verses.text: The vast unmeasurable sea, gathered together by His working into various basins, never passes beyond the bounds placed around it, but does as He has commanded.

verses.name: 1 Clement 20:9
verses.text: For He said, "Thus far shalt thou come, and thy waves shall be broken within thee".

verses.name: 1 Clement 20:10
verses.text: The ocean, impassable to man and the worlds beyond it, are regulated by the same enactments of the Lord.

verses.name: 1 Clement 20:11
verses.text: The seasons of spring, summer, autumn, and winter, peacefully give place to one another.

verses.name: 1 Clement 20:12
verses.text: The winds in their several quarters fulfil, at the proper time, their service without hindrance.

verses.name: 1 Clement 20:13
verses.text: The ever-flowing fountains, formed both for enjoyment and health, furnish without fail their breasts for the life of men.

verses.name: 1 Clement 20:14
verses.text: The very smallest of living beings meet together in peace and concord.

verses.name: 1 Clement 20:15
verses.text: All these the great Creator and Lord of all has appointed to exist in peace and harmony; while He does good to all, but most abundantly to us who have fled for refuge to His compassions through Jesus Christ our Lord, to whom be glory and majesty for ever and ever, Amen.

verses.name: 1 Clement 21:1
verses.text: Chapter XXI.

verses.name: 1 Clement 21:2
verses.text: —Let Us Obey God, and Not the Authors of Sedition.

verses.name: 1 Clement 21:3
verses.text: Take heed, beloved, lest His many kindnesses lead to the condemnation of us all.

verses.name: 1 Clement 21:4
verses.text: For thus it must be unless we walk worthy of Him, and with one mind do those things which are good and well-pleasing in His sight.

verses.name: 1 Clement 21:5
verses.text: For the Scripture saith in a certain place, "The Spirit of the Lord is a candle searching the secret parts of the belly".

verses.name: 1 Clement 21:6
verses.text: Let us reflect how near He is, and that none of the thoughts or reasonings in which we engage are hid from Him.

verses.name: 1 Clement 21:7
verses.text: It is right, therefore, that we should not leave the post which His will has assigned us.

verses.name: 1 Clement 21:8
verses.text: Let us rather offend those men who are foolish, and inconsiderate, and lifted up, and who glory in the pride of their speech, than offend God.

verses.name: 1 Clement 21:9
verses.text: Let us reverence the Lord Jesus Christ, whose blood was given for us; let us esteem those who have the rule over us; let us honour the aged among us; let us train up the young men in the fear of God; let us direct our wives to that which is good.

verses.name: 1 Clement 21:10
verses.text: Let them exhibit the lovely habit of purity in all their conduct; let them show forth the sincere disposition of meekness; let them make manifest the command which they have of their tongue, by their manner of speaking; let them display their love, not by preferring one to another, but by showing equal affection to all that piously fear God.

verses.name: 1 Clement 21:11
verses.text: Let your children be partakers of true Christian training; let them learn of how great avail humility is with God—how much the spirit of pure affection can prevail with Him—how excellent and great His fear is, and how it saves all those who walk in it with a pure mind.

verses.name: 1 Clement 21:12
verses.text: For He is a Searcher of the thoughts and desires of the heart: His breath is in us; and when He pleases, He will take it away.

verses.name: 1 Clement 22:1
verses.text: Chapter XXII.

verses.name: 1 Clement 22:2
verses.text: —These Exhortations are Confirmed by the Christian Faith, Which Proclaims the Misery of Sinful Conduct.

verses.name: 1 Clement 22:3
verses.text: Now the faith which is in Christ confirms all these admonitions.

verses.name: 1 Clement 22:4
verses.text: For He Himself by the Holy Ghost thus addresses us: "Come, ye children, hearken unto me; I will teach you the fear of the Lord.

verses.name: 1 Clement 22:5
verses.text: What man is he that desireth life, and loveth to see good days? Keep thy tongue from evil, and thy lips from speaking guile.

verses.name: 1 Clement 22:6
verses.text: Depart from evil, and do good; seek peace, and pursue it.

verses.name: 1 Clement 22:7
verses.text: The eyes of the Lord are upon the righteous, and His ears are open unto their prayers.

verses.name: 1 Clement 22:8
verses.text: The face of the Lord is against them that do evil, to cut off the remembrance of them from the earth.

verses.name: 1 Clement 22:9
verses.text: The righteous cried, and the Lord heard him, and delivered him out of all his troubles".

verses.name: 1 Clement 22:10
verses.text: "Many are the stripes appointed for the wicked; but mercy shall compass those about who hope in the Lord".

verses.name: 1 Clement 23:1
verses.text: Chapter XXIII.

verses.name: 1 Clement 23:2
verses.text: —Be Humble, and Believe that Christ Will Come Again.

verses.name: 1 Clement 23:3
verses.text: The all-merciful and beneficent Father has bowels of compassion towards those that fear Him, and kindly and lovingly bestows His favours upon those who come to Him with a simple mind.

verses.name: 1 Clement 23:4
verses.text: Wherefore let us not be double-minded; neither let our soul be lifted up on account of His exceedingly great and glorious gifts.

verses.name: 1 Clement 23:5
verses.text: Far from us be that which is written, "Wretched are they who are of a double mind, and of a doubting heart; who say, These things we have heard even in the times of our fathers; but, behold, we have grown old, and none of them has happened unto us;" Ye foolish ones! compare yourselves to a tree; take for instance the vine.

verses.name: 1 Clement 23:6
verses.text: First of all, it sheds its leaves, then it buds, next it puts forth leaves, and then it flowers; after that comes the sour grape, and then follows the ripened fruit.

verses.name: 1 Clement 23:7
verses.text: Ye perceive how in a little time the fruit of a tree comes to maturity.

verses.name: 1 Clement 23:8
verses.text: Of a truth, soon and suddenly shall His will be accomplished, as the Scripture also bears witness, saying, "Speedily will He come, and will not tarry;" and, "The Lord shall suddenly come to His temple, even the Holy One, for whom ye look".

verses.name: 1 Clement 24:1
verses.text: Chapter XXIV.

verses.name: 1 Clement 24:2
verses.text: —God Continually Shows Us in Nature that There Will Be a Resurrection.

verses.name: 1 Clement 24:3
verses.text: Let us consider, beloved, how the Lord continually proves to us that there shall be a future resurrection, of which He has rendered the Lord Jesus Christ the first-fruits by raising Him from the dead.

verses.name: 1 Clement 24:4
verses.text: Let us contemplate, beloved, the resurrection which is at all times taking place.

verses.name: 1 Clement 24:5
verses.text: Day and night declare to us a resurrection.

verses.name: 1 Clement 24:6
verses.text: The night sinks to sleep, and the day arises; the day again departs, and the night comes on.

verses.name: 1 Clement 24:7
verses.text: Let us behold the fruits of the earth, how the sowing of grain takes place.

verses.name: 1 Clement 24:8
verses.text: The sower goes forth, and casts it into the ground, and the seed being thus scattered, though dry and naked when it fell upon the earth, is gradually dissolved.

verses.name: 1 Clement 24:9
verses.text: Then out of its dissolution the mighty power of the providence of the Lord raises it up again, and from one seed many arise and bring forth fruit.

verses.name: 1 Clement 25:1
verses.text: Chapter XXV.

verses.name: 1 Clement 25:2
verses.text: —The Phoenix an Emblem of Our Resurrection.

verses.name: 1 Clement 25:3
verses.text: Let us consider that wonderful sign of the resurrection which takes place in eastern lands, that is, in Arabia and the countries round about.

verses.name: 1 Clement 25:4
verses.text: There is a certain bird which is called a phoenix.

verses.name: 1 Clement 25:5
verses.text: This is the only one of its kind, and lives five hundred years.

verses.name: 1 Clement 25:6
verses.text: And when the time of its dissolution draws near that it must die, it builds itself a nest of frankincense, and myrrh, and other spices, into which, when the time is fulfilled, it enters and dies.

verses.name: 1 Clement 25:7
verses.text: But as the flesh decays a certain kind of worm is produced, which, being nourished by the juices of the deed bird, brings forth feathers.

verses.name: 1 Clement 25:8
verses.text: Then, when it has acquired strength, it takes up that nest in which are the bones of its parent, and bearing these it passes from the land of Arabia into Egypt, to the city called Heliopolis.

verses.name: 1 Clement 25:9
verses.text: And, in open day, flying in the sight of all men, it places them on the altar of the sun, and having done this, hastens back to its former abode.

verses.name: 1 Clement 25:10
verses.text: The priests then inspect the registers of the dates, and find that it has returned exactly as the five hundredth year was completed.

verses.name: 1 Clement 26:1
verses.text: Chapter XXVI.

verses.name: 1 Clement 26:2
verses.text: —We Shall Rise Again, Then, as the Scripture Also Testifies.

verses.name: 1 Clement 26:3
verses.text: Do we then deem it any great and wonderful thing for the Maker of all things to raise up again those that have piously served Him in the assurance of a good faith, when even by a bird He shows us the mightiness of His power to fulfil His promise? For the Scripture saith in a certain place, "Thou shalt raise me up, and I shall confess unto Thee"; and again, "I laid me down, and slept"; "I awaked, because Thou art with me;" and again, Job says, "Thou shalt raise up this flesh of mine, which has suffered all these things".

verses.name: 1 Clement 27:1
verses.text: Chapter XXVII.

verses.name: 1 Clement 27:2
verses.text: —In the Hope of the Resurrection, Let Us Cleave to the Omnipotent and Omniscient God.

verses.name: 1 Clement 27:3
verses.text: Having then this hope, let our souls be bound to Him who is faithful in His promises, and just in His judgments.

verses.name: 1 Clement 27:4
verses.text: He who has commanded us not to lie, shall much more Himself not lie; for nothing is impossible with God, except to lie.

verses.name: 1 Clement 27:5
verses.text: Let His faith therefore be stirred up again within us, and let us consider that all things are nigh unto Him.

verses.name: 1 Clement 27:6
verses.text: By the word of His might He established all things, and by His word He can overthrow them.

verses.name: 1 Clement 27:7
verses.text: "Who shall say unto Him, What hast thou done? or, Who shall resist the power of His strength?" When, and as He pleases, He will do all things, and none of the things determined by Him shall pass away.

verses.name: 1 Clement 27:8
verses.text: All things are open before Him, and nothing can be hidden from His counsel.

verses.name: 1 Clement 27:9
verses.text: "The heavens declare the glory of God, and the firmament showeth His handy-work.

verses.name: 1 Clement 27:10
verses.text: Day unto day uttereth speech, and night unto night showeth knowledge.

verses.name: 1 Clement 27:11
verses.text: And there are no words or speeches of which the voices are not heard".

verses.name: 1 Clement 28:1
verses.text: Chapter XXVIII.

verses.name: 1 Clement 28:2
verses.text: —God Sees All Things: Therefore Let Us Avoid Transgression.

verses.name: 1 Clement 28:3
verses.text: Since then all things are seen and heard by God, let us fear Him, and forsake those wicked works which proceed from evil desires; so that, through His mercy, we may be protected from the judgments to come.

verses.name: 1 Clement 28:4
verses.text: For whither can any of us flee from His mighty hand? Or what world will receive any of those who run away from Him? For the Scripture saith in a certain place, "Whither shall I go, and where shall I be hid from Thy presence? If I ascend into heaven, Thou art there; if I go away even to the uttermost parts of the earth, there is Thy right hand; if I make my bed in the abyss, there is Thy Spirit".

verses.name: 1 Clement 28:5
verses.text: Whither, then, shall anyone go, or where shall he escape from Him who comprehends all things?.

verses.name: 1 Clement 29:1
verses.text: Chapter XXIX.

verses.name: 1 Clement 29:2
verses.text: —Let Us Also Draw Near to God in Purity of Heart.

verses.name: 1 Clement 29:3
verses.text: Let us then draw near to Him with holiness of spirit, lifting up pure and undefiled hands unto Him, loving our gracious and merciful Father, who has made us partakers in the blessings of His elect.

verses.name: 1 Clement 29:4
verses.text: For thus it is written, "When the Most High divided the nations, when He scattered the sons of Adam, He fixed the bounds of the nations according to the number of the angels of God.

verses.name: 1 Clement 29:5
verses.text: His people Jacob became the portion of the Lord, and Israel the lot of His inheritance.

verses.name: 1 Clement 29:6
verses.text: And in another place the Scripture saith, "Behold, the Lord taketh unto Himself a nation out of the midst of the nations, as a man takes the first-fruits of his threshing-floor; and from that nation shall come forth the Most Holy".

verses.name: 1 Clement 30:1
verses.text: Chapter XXX.

verses.name: 1 Clement 30:2
verses.text: —Let Us Do Those Things that Please God, and Flee from Those He Hates, that We May Be Blessed.

verses.name: 1 Clement 30:3
verses.text: Seeing, therefore, that we are the portion of the Holy One, let us do all those things which pertain to holiness, avoiding all evil-speaking, all abominable and impure embraces, together with all drunkenness, seeking after change, all abominable lusts, detestable adultery, and execrable pride.

verses.name: 1 Clement 30:4
verses.text: "For God," saith the Scripture, "resisteth the proud, but giveth grace to the humble".

verses.name: 1 Clement 30:5
verses.text: Let us cleave, then, to those to whom grace has been given by God.

verses.name: 1 Clement 30:6
verses.text: Let us clothe ourselves with concord and humility, ever exercising self-control, standing far off from all whispering and evil-speaking, being justified by our works, and not our words.

verses.name: 1 Clement 30:7
verses.text: For the Scripture saith, "He that speaketh much, shall also hear much in answer.

verses.name: 1 Clement 30:8
verses.text: And does he that is ready in speech deem himself righteous? Blessed is he that is born of woman, who liveth but a short time: be not given to much speaking".

verses.name: 1 Clement 30:9
verses.text: Let our praise be in God, and not of ourselves; for God hateth those that commend themselves.

verses.name: 1 Clement 30:10
verses.text: Let testimony to our good deeds be borne by others, as it was in the case of our righteous forefathers.

verses.name: 1 Clement 30:11
verses.text: Boldness, and arrogance, and audacity belong to those that are accursed of God; but moderation, humility, and meekness to such as are blessed by Him.

verses.name: 1 Clement 31:1
verses.text: Chapter XXXI.

verses.name: 1 Clement 31:2
verses.text: —Let Us See by What Means We May Obtain the Divine Blessing.

verses.name: 1 Clement 31:3
verses.text: Let us cleave then to His blessing, and consider what are the means of possessing it.

verses.name: 1 Clement 31:4
verses.text: Let us think over the things which have taken place from the beginning.

verses.name: 1 Clement 31:5
verses.text: For what reason was our father Abraham blessed? Was it not because he wrought righteousness and truth through faith? Isaac, with perfect confidence, as if knowing what was to happen, cheerfully yielded himself as a sacrifice.

verses.name: 1 Clement 31:6
verses.text: Jacob, through reason of his brother, went forth with humility from his own land, and came to Laban and served him; and there was given to him the sceptre of the twelve tribes of Israel.

verses.name: 1 Clement 32:1
verses.text: Chapter XXXII.

verses.name: 1 Clement 32:2
verses.text: —We are Justified Not by Our Own Works, But by Faith.

verses.name: 1 Clement 32:3
verses.text: Whosoever will candidly consider each particular, will recognise the greatness of the gifts which were given by him.

verses.name: 1 Clement 32:4
verses.text: For from him have sprung the priests and all the Levites who minister at the altar of God.

verses.name: 1 Clement 32:5
verses.text: From him also was descended our Lord Jesus Christ according to the flesh.

verses.name: 1 Clement 32:6
verses.text: From him arose kings, princes, and rulers of the race of Judah.

verses.name: 1 Clement 32:7
verses.text: Nor are his other tribes in small glory, inasmuch as God had promised, "Thy seed shall be as the stars of heaven".

verses.name: 1 Clement 32:8
verses.text: All these, therefore, were highly honoured, and made great, not for their own sake, or for their own works, or for the righteousness which they wrought, but through the operation of His will.

verses.name: 1 Clement 32:9
verses.text: And we, too, being called by His will in Christ Jesus, are not justified by ourselves, nor by our own wisdom, or understanding, or godliness, or works which we have wrought in holiness of heart; but by that faith through which, from the beginning, Almighty God has justified all men; to whom be glory for ever and ever, Amen.

verses.name: 1 Clement 33:1
verses.text: Chapter XXXIII.

verses.name: 1 Clement 33:2
verses.text: —But Let Us Not Give Up the Practice of Good Works and Love.

verses.name: 1 Clement 33:3
verses.text: God Himself is an Example to Us of Good Works.

verses.name: 1 Clement 33:4
verses.text: What shall we do, then, brethren? Shall we become slothful in well-doing, and cease from the practice of love? God forbid that any such course should be followed by us! But rather let us hasten with all energy and readiness of mind to perform every good work.

verses.name: 1 Clement 33:5
verses.text: For the Creator and Lord of all Himself rejoices in His works.

verses.name: 1 Clement 33:6
verses.text: For by His infinitely great power He established the heavens, and by His incomprehensible wisdom He adorned them.

verses.name: 1 Clement 33:7
verses.text: He also divided the earth from the water which surrounds it, and fixed it upon the immovable foundation of His own will.

verses.name: 1 Clement 33:8
verses.text: The animals also which are upon it He commanded by His own word into existence.

verses.name: 1 Clement 33:9
verses.text: So likewise, when He had formed the sea, and the living creatures which are in it, He enclosed them within their proper bounds by His own power.

verses.name: 1 Clement 33:10
verses.text: Above all, with His holy and undefiled hands He formed man, the most excellent of His creatures, and truly great through the understanding given him—the express likeness of His own image.

verses.name: 1 Clement 33:11
verses.text: For thus says God: "Let us make man in our image, and after our likeness.

verses.name: 1 Clement 33:12
verses.text: So God made man; male and female He created them".

verses.name: 1 Clement 33:13
verses.text: Having thus finished all these things, He approved them, and blessed them, and said, "Increase and multiply".

verses.name: 1 Clement 33:14
verses.text: We see, then, how all righteous men have been adorned with good works, and how the Lord Himself, adorning Himself with His works, rejoiced.

verses.name: 1 Clement 33:15
verses.text: Having therefore such an example, let us without delay accede to His will, and let us work the work of righteousness with our whole strength.

verses.name: 1 Clement 34:1
verses.text: Chapter XXXIV.

verses.name: 1 Clement 34:2
verses.text: —Great is the Reward of Good Works with God.

verses.name: 1 Clement 34:3
verses.text: Joined Together in Harmony, Let Us Implore that Reward from Him.

verses.name: 1 Clement 34:4
verses.text: The good servant receives the bread of his labour with confidence; the lazy and slothful cannot look his employer in the face.

verses.name: 1 Clement 34:5
verses.text: It is requisite, therefore, that we be prompt in the practice of well-doing; for of Him are all things.

verses.name: 1 Clement 34:6
verses.text: And thus He forewarns us: "Behold, the Lord cometh, and His reward is before His face, to render to every man according to his work".

verses.name: 1 Clement 34:7
verses.text: He exhorts us, therefore, with our whole heart to attend to this, that we be not lazy or slothful in any good work.

verses.name: 1 Clement 34:8
verses.text: Let our boasting and our confidence be in Him.

verses.name: 1 Clement 34:9
verses.text: Let us submit ourselves to His will.

verses.name: 1 Clement 34:10
verses.text: Let us consider the whole multitude of His angels, how they stand ever ready to minister to His will.

verses.name: 1 Clement 34:11
verses.text: For the Scripture saith, "Ten thousand times ten thousand stood around Him, and thousands of thousands ministered unto Him, and cried, Holy, holy, holy, is the Lord of Sabaoth; the whole creation is full of His glory".

verses.name: 1 Clement 34:12
verses.text: And let us therefore, conscientiously gathering together in harmony, cry to Him earnestly, as with one mouth, that we may be made partakers of His great and glorious promises.

verses.name: 1 Clement 34:13
verses.text: For the Scripture saith, "Eye hath not seen, nor ear heard, neither have entered into the heart of man, the things which He hath prepared for them that wait for Him".

verses.name: 1 Clement 35:1
verses.text: Chapter XXXV.

verses.name: 1 Clement 35:2
verses.text: —Immense is This Reward.

verses.name: 1 Clement 35:3
verses.text: How Shall We Obtain It?  How blessed and wonderful, beloved, are the gifts of God! Life in immortality, splendour in righteousness, truth in perfect confidence, faith in assurance, self-control in holiness! And all these fall under the cognizance of our understandings now; what then shall those things be which are prepared for such as wait for Him? The Creator and Father of all worlds, the Most Holy, alone knows their amount and their beauty.

verses.name: 1 Clement 35:4
verses.text: Let us therefore earnestly strive to be found in the number of those that wait for Him, in order that we may share in His promised gifts.

verses.name: 1 Clement 35:5
verses.text: But how, beloved, shall this be done? If our understanding be fixed by faith towards God; if we earnestly seek the things which are pleasing and acceptable to Him; if we do the things which are in harmony with His blameless will; and if we follow the way of truth, casting away from us all unrighteousness and iniquity, along with all covetousness, strife, evil practices, deceit, whispering, and evil-speaking, all hatred of God, pride and haughtiness, vain glory and ambition.

verses.name: 1 Clement 35:6
verses.text: For they that do such things are hateful to God; and not only they that do them, but also those that take pleasure in them that do them.

verses.name: 1 Clement 35:7
verses.text: For the Scripture saith, "But to the sinner God said, Wherefore dost thou declare my statutes, and take my covenant into thy mouth, seeing thou hatest instruction, and castest my words behind thee? When thou sawest a thief, thou consentedst with him, and didst make thy portion with adulterers.

verses.name: 1 Clement 35:8
verses.text: Thy mouth has abounded with wickedness, and thy tongue contrived deceit.

verses.name: 1 Clement 35:9
verses.text: Thou sittest, and speakest against thy brother; thou slanderest thine own mother's son.

verses.name: 1 Clement 35:10
verses.text: These things thou hast done, and I kept silence; thou thoughtest, wicked one, that I should be like to thyself.

verses.name: 1 Clement 35:11
verses.text: But I will reprove thee, and set thyself before thee.

verses.name: 1 Clement 35:12
verses.text: Consider now these things, ye that forget God, lest He tear you in pieces, like a lion, and there be none to deliver.

verses.name: 1 Clement 35:13
verses.text: The sacrifice of praise will glorify me, and a way is there by which I will show him the salvation of God".

verses.name: 1 Clement 36:1
verses.text: Chapter XXXVI.

verses.name: 1 Clement 36:2
verses.text: —All Blessings are Given to Us Through Christ.

verses.name: 1 Clement 36:3
verses.text: This is the way, beloved, in which we find our Saviour, even Jesus Christ, the High Priest of all our offerings, the defender and helper of our infirmity.

verses.name: 1 Clement 36:4
verses.text: By Him we look up to the heights of heaven.

verses.name: 1 Clement 36:5
verses.text: By Him we behold, as in a glass, His immaculate and most excellent visage.

verses.name: 1 Clement 36:6
verses.text: By Him are the eyes of our hearts opened.

verses.name: 1 Clement 36:7
verses.text: By Him our foolish and darkened understanding blossoms up anew towards His marvellous light.

verses.name: 1 Clement 36:8
verses.text: By Him the Lord has willed that we should taste of immortal knowledge, "who, being the brightness of His majesty, is by so much greater than the angels, as He hath by inheritance obtained a more excellent name than they".

verses.name: 1 Clement 36:9
verses.text: For it is thus written, "Who maketh His angels spirits, and His ministers a flame of fire".

verses.name: 1 Clement 36:10
verses.text: But concerning His Son the Lord spoke thus: "Thou art my Son, to-day have I begotten Thee.

verses.name: 1 Clement 36:11
verses.text: Ask of me, and I will give Thee the heathen for Thine inheritance, and the uttermost parts of the earth for Thy possession".

verses.name: 1 Clement 36:12
verses.text: And again He saith to Him, "Sit Thou at my right hand, until I make Thine enemies Thy footstool".

verses.name: 1 Clement 36:13
verses.text: But who are His enemies? All the wicked, and those who set themselves to oppose the will of God.

verses.name: 1 Clement 37:1
verses.text: Chapter XXXVII.

verses.name: 1 Clement 37:2
verses.text: —Christ is Our Leader, and We His Soldiers.

verses.name: 1 Clement 37:3
verses.text: Let us then, men and brethren, with all energy act the part of soldiers, in accordance with His holy commandments.

verses.name: 1 Clement 37:4
verses.text: Let us consider those who serve under our generals, with what order, obedience, and submissiveness they perform the things which are commanded them.

verses.name: 1 Clement 37:5
verses.text: All are not prefects, nor commanders of a thousand, nor of a hundred, nor of fifty, nor the like, but each one in his own rank performs the things commanded by the king and the generals.

verses.name: 1 Clement 37:6
verses.text: The great cannot subsist without the small, nor the small without the great.

verses.name: 1 Clement 37:7
verses.text: There is a kind of mixture in all things, and thence arises mutual advantage.

verses.name: 1 Clement 37:8
verses.text: Let us take our body for an example.

verses.name: 1 Clement 37:9
verses.text: The head is nothing without the feet, and the feet are nothing without the head; yea, the very smallest members of our body are necessary and useful to the whole body.

verses.name: 1 Clement 37:10
verses.text: But all work harmoniously together, and are under one common rule for the preservation of the whole body.

verses.name: 1 Clement 38:1
verses.text: Chapter XXXVIII.

verses.name: 1 Clement 38:2
verses.text: —Let the Members of the Church Submit Themselves, and No One Exalt Himself Above Another.

verses.name: 1 Clement 38:3
verses.text: Let our whole body, then, be preserved in Christ Jesus; and let every one be subject to his neighbour, according to the special gift bestowed upon him.

verses.name: 1 Clement 38:4
verses.text: Let the strong not despise the weak, and let the weak show respect unto the strong.

verses.name: 1 Clement 38:5
verses.text: Let the rich man provide for the wants of the poor; and let the poor man bless God, because He hath given him one by whom his need may be supplied.

verses.name: 1 Clement 38:6
verses.text: Let the wise man display his wisdom, not by mere words, but through good deeds.

verses.name: 1 Clement 38:7
verses.text: Let the humble not bear testimony to himself, but leave witness to be borne to him by another.

verses.name: 1 Clement 38:8
verses.text: Let him that is pure in the flesh not grow proud of it, and boast, knowing that it was another who bestowed on him the gift of continence.

verses.name: 1 Clement 38:9
verses.text: Let us consider, then, brethren, of what matter we were made,—who and what manner of beings we came into the world, as it were out of a sepulchre, and from utter darkness.

verses.name: 1 Clement 38:10
verses.text: He who made us and fashioned us, having prepared His bountiful gifts for us before we were born, introduced us into His world.

verses.name: 1 Clement 38:11
verses.text: Since, therefore, we receive all these things from Him, we ought for everything to give Him thanks; to whom be glory for ever and ever, Amen.

verses.name: 1 Clement 39:1
verses.text: Chapter XXXIX.

verses.name: 1 Clement 39:2
verses.text: —There is No Reason for Self-Conceit.

verses.name: 1 Clement 39:3
verses.text: Foolish and inconsiderate men, who have neither wisdom nor instruction, mock and deride us, being eager to exalt themselves in their own conceits.

verses.name: 1 Clement 39:4
verses.text: For what can a mortal man do, or what strength is there in one made out of the dust? For it is written, "There was no shape before mine eyes, only I heard a sound, and a voice saying, What then? Shall a man be pure before the Lord? Or shall such an one be counted blameless in his deeds, seeing He does not confide in His servants, and has charged even His angels with perversity? The heaven is not clean in His sight: how much less they that dwell in houses of clay, of which also we ourselves were made! He smote them as a moth; and from morning even until evening they endure not.

verses.name: 1 Clement 39:5
verses.text: Because they could furnish no assistance to themselves, they perished.

verses.name: 1 Clement 39:6
verses.text: He breathed upon them, and they died, because they had no wisdom.

verses.name: 1 Clement 39:7
verses.text: But call now, if any one will answer thee, or if thou wilt look to any of the holy angels; for wrath destroys the foolish man, and envy killeth him that is in error.

verses.name: 1 Clement 39:8
verses.text: I have seen the foolish taking root, but their habitation was presently consumed.

verses.name: 1 Clement 39:9
verses.text: Let their sons be far from safety; let them be despised before the gates of those less than themselves, and there shall be none to deliver.

verses.name: 1 Clement 39:10
verses.text: For what was prepared for them, the righteous shall eat; and they shall not be delivered from evil".

verses.name: 1 Clement 40:1
verses.text: Chapter XL.

verses.name: 1 Clement 40:2
verses.text: —Let Us Preserve in the Church the Order Appointed by God.

verses.name: 1 Clement 40:3
verses.text: These things therefore being manifest to us, and since we look into the depths of the divine knowledge, it behoves us to do all things in their proper order, which the Lord has commanded us to perform at stated times.

verses.name: 1 Clement 40:4
verses.text: He has enjoined offerings to be presented and service to be performed to Him, and that not thoughtlessly or irregularly, but at the appointed times and hours.

verses.name: 1 Clement 40:5
verses.text: Where and by whom He desires these things to be done, He Himself has fixed by His own supreme will, in order that all things, being piously done according to His good pleasure, may be acceptable unto Him.

verses.name: 1 Clement 40:6
verses.text: Those, therefore, who present their offerings at the appointed times, are accepted and blessed; for inasmuch as they follow the laws of the Lord, they sin not.

verses.name: 1 Clement 40:7
verses.text: For his own peculiar services are assigned to the high priest, and their own proper place is prescribed to the priests, and their own special ministrations devolve on the Levites.

verses.name: 1 Clement 40:8
verses.text: The layman is bound by the laws that pertain to laymen.

verses.name: 1 Clement 41:1
verses.text: Chapter XLI.

verses.name: 1 Clement 41:2
verses.text: —Continuation of the Same Subject.

verses.name: 1 Clement 41:3
verses.text: Let every one of you, brethren, give thanks to God in his own order, living in all good conscience, with becoming gravity, and not going beyond the rule of the ministry prescribed to him.

verses.name: 1 Clement 41:4
verses.text: Not in every place, brethren, are the daily sacrifices offered, or the peace-offerings, or the sin-offerings and the trespass-offerings, but in Jerusalem only.

verses.name: 1 Clement 41:5
verses.text: And even there they are not offered in any place, but only at the altar before the temple, that which is offered being first carefully examined by the high priest and the ministers already mentioned.

verses.name: 1 Clement 41:6
verses.text: Those, therefore, who do anything beyond that which is agreeable to His will, are punished with death.

verses.name: 1 Clement 41:7
verses.text: Ye see, brethren, that the greater the knowledge that has been vouchsafed to us, the greater also is the danger to which we are exposed.

verses.name: 1 Clement 42:1
verses.text: Chapter XLII.

verses.name: 1 Clement 42:2
verses.text: —The Order of Ministers in the Church.

verses.name: 1 Clement 42:3
verses.text: The apostles have preached the gospel to us from the Lord Jesus Christ; Jesus Christ has done so from God.

verses.name: 1 Clement 42:4
verses.text: Christ therefore was sent forth by God, and the apostles by Christ.

verses.name: 1 Clement 42:5
verses.text: Both these appointments, then, were made in an orderly way, according to the will of God.

verses.name: 1 Clement 42:6
verses.text: Having therefore received their orders, and being fully assured by the resurrection of our Lord Jesus Christ, and established in the word of God, with full assurance of the Holy Ghost, they went forth proclaiming that the kingdom of God was at hand.

verses.name: 1 Clement 42:7
verses.text: And thus preaching through countries and cities, they appointed the first fruits of their labours, having first proved them by the Spirit, to be bishops and deacons of those who should afterwards believe.

verses.name: 1 Clement 42:8
verses.text: Nor was this any new thing, since indeed many ages before it was written concerning bishops and deacons.

verses.name: 1 Clement 42:9
verses.text: For thus saith the Scripture in a certain place, "I will appoint their bishops in righteousness, and their deacons in faith".

verses.name: 1 Clement 43:1
verses.text: Chapter XLIII.

verses.name: 1 Clement 43:2
verses.text: —Moses of Old Stilled the Contention Which Arose Concerning the Priestly Dignity.

verses.name: 1 Clement 43:3
verses.text: And what wonder is it if those in Christ who were entrusted with such a duty by God, appointed those ministers before mentioned, when the blessed Moses also, "a faithful servant in all his house," noted down in the sacred books all the injunctions which were given him, and when the other prophets also followed him, bearing witness with one consent to the ordinances which he had appointed? For, when rivalry arose concerning the priesthood, and the tribes were contending among themselves as to which of them should be adorned with that glorious title, he commanded the twelve princes of the tribes to bring him their rods, each one being inscribed with the name of the tribe.

verses.name: 1 Clement 43:4
verses.text: And he took them and bound them together, and sealed them with the rings of the princes of the tribes, and laid them up in the tabernacle of witness on the table of God.

verses.name: 1 Clement 43:5
verses.text: And having shut the doors of the tabernacle, he sealed the keys, as he had done the rods, and said to them, Men and brethren, the tribe whose rod shall blossom has God chosen to fulfil the office of the priesthood, and to minister unto Him.

verses.name: 1 Clement 43:6
verses.text: And when the morning was come, he assembled all Israel, six hundred thousand men, and showed the seals to the princes of the tribes, and opened the tabernacle of witness, and brought forth the rods.

verses.name: 1 Clement 43:7
verses.text: And the rod of Aaron was found not only to have blossomed, but to bear fruit upon it.

verses.name: 1 Clement 43:8
verses.text: What think ye, beloved? Did not Moses know beforehand that this would happen? Undoubtedly he knew; but he acted thus, that there might be no sedition in Israel, and that the name of the true and only God might be glorified; to whom be glory for ever and ever, Amen.

verses.name: 1 Clement 44:1
verses.text: Chapter XLIV.

verses.name: 1 Clement 44:2
verses.text: —The Ordinances of the Apostles, that There Might Be No Contention Respecting the Priestly Office.

verses.name: 1 Clement 44:3
verses.text: Our apostles also knew, through our Lord Jesus Christ, that there would be strife on account of the office of the episcopate.

verses.name: 1 Clement 44:4
verses.text: For this reason, therefore, inasmuch as they had obtained a perfect fore-knowledge of this, they appointed those ministers already mentioned, and afterwards gave instructions, that when these should fall asleep, other approved men should succeed them in their ministry.

verses.name: 1 Clement 44:5
verses.text: We are of opinion, therefore, that those appointed by them, or afterwards by other eminent men, with the consent of the whole church, and who have blamelessly served the flock of Christ, in a humble, peaceable, and disinterested spirit, and have for a long time possessed the good opinion of all, cannot be justly dismissed from the ministry.

verses.name: 1 Clement 44:6
verses.text: For our sin will not be small, if we eject from the episcopate those who have blamelessly and holily fulfilled its duties.

verses.name: 1 Clement 44:7
verses.text: Blessed are those presbyters who, having finished their course before now, have obtained a fruitful and perfect departure from this world; for they have no fear lest any one deprive them of the place now appointed them.

verses.name: 1 Clement 44:8
verses.text: But we see that ye have removed some men of excellent behaviour from the ministry, which they fulfilled blamelessly and with honour.

verses.name: 1 Clement 45:1
verses.text: Chapter XLV.

verses.name: 1 Clement 45:2
verses.text: —It is the Part of the Wicked to Vex the Righteous.

verses.name: 1 Clement 45:3
verses.text: Ye are fond of contention, brethren, and full of zeal about things which do not pertain to salvation.

verses.name: 1 Clement 45:4
verses.text: Look carefully into the Scriptures, which are the true utterances of the Holy Spirit.

verses.name: 1 Clement 45:5
verses.text: Observe that nothing of an unjust or counterfeit character is written in them.

verses.name: 1 Clement 45:6
verses.text: There you will not find that the righteous were cast off by men who themselves were holy.

verses.name: 1 Clement 45:7
verses.text: The righteous were indeed persecuted, but only by the wicked.

verses.name: 1 Clement 45:8
verses.text: They were cast into prison, but only by the unholy; they were stoned, but only by transgressors; they were slain, but only by the accursed, and such as had conceived an unrighteous envy against them.

verses.name: 1 Clement 45:9
verses.text: Exposed to such sufferings, they endured them gloriously.

verses.name: 1 Clement 45:10
verses.text: For what shall we say, brethren? Was Daniel cast into the den of lions by such as feared God? Were Ananias, and Azarias, and Michael shut up in a furnace of fire by those who observed the great and glorious worship of the Most High? Far from us be such a thought! Who, then, were they that did such things? The hateful, and those full of all wickedness, were roused to such a pitch of fury, that they inflicted torture on those who served God with a holy and blameless purpose of heart, not knowing that the Most High is the Defender and Protector of all such as with a pure conscience venerate His all-excellent name; to whom be glory for ever and ever, Amen.

verses.name: 1 Clement 45:11
verses.text: But they who with confidence endured these things are now heirs of glory and honour, and have been exalted and made illustrious by God in their memorial for ever and ever, Amen.

verses.name: 1 Clement 46:1
verses.text: Chapter XLVI.

verses.name: 1 Clement 46:2
verses.text: —Let Us Cleave to the Righteous: Your Strife is Pernicious.

verses.name: 1 Clement 46:3
verses.text: Such examples, therefore, brethren, it is right that we should follow; since it is written, "Cleave to the holy, for those that cleave to them shall themselves be made holy".

verses.name: 1 Clement 46:4
verses.text: And again, in another place, the Scripture saith, "With a harmless man thou shalt prove thyself harmless, and with an elect man thou shalt be elect, and with a perverse man thou shalt show thyself perverse".

verses.name: 1 Clement 46:5
verses.text: Let us cleave, therefore, to the innocent and righteous, since these are the elect of God.

verses.name: 1 Clement 46:6
verses.text: Why are there strifes, and tumults, and divisions, and schisms, and wars among you? Have we not all one God and one Christ? Is there not one Spirit of grace poured out upon us? And have we not one calling in Christ? Why do we divide and tear in pieces the members of Christ, and raise up strife against our own body, and have reached such a height of madness as to forget that "we are members one of another?" Remember the words of our Lord Jesus Christ, how He said, "Woe to that man by whom offences come! It were better for him that he had never been born, than that he should cast a stumbling-block before one of my elect.

verses.name: 1 Clement 46:7
verses.text: Yea, it were better for him that a millstone should be hung about his neck, and he should be sunk in the depths of the sea, than that he should cast a stumbling-block before one of my little ones".

verses.name: 1 Clement 46:8
verses.text: Your schism has subverted the faith of many, has discouraged many, has given rise to doubt in many, and has caused grief to us all.

verses.name: 1 Clement 46:9
verses.text: And still your sedition continueth.

verses.name: 1 Clement 47:1
verses.text: Chapter XLVII.

verses.name: 1 Clement 47:2
verses.text: —Your Recent Discord is Worse Than the Former Which Took Place in the Times of Paul.

verses.name: 1 Clement 47:3
verses.text: Take up the epistle of the blessed Apostle Paul.

verses.name: 1 Clement 47:4
verses.text: What did he write to you at the time when the gospel first began to be preached? Truly, under the inspiration of the Spirit, he wrote to you concerning himself, and Cephas, and Apollos, because even then parties had been formed among you.

verses.name: 1 Clement 47:5
verses.text: But that inclination for one above another entailed less guilt upon you, inasmuch as your partialities were then shown towards apostles, already of high reputation, and towards a man whom they had approved.

verses.name: 1 Clement 47:6
verses.text: But now reflect who those are that have perverted you, and lessened the renown of your far-famed brotherly love.

verses.name: 1 Clement 47:7
verses.text: It is disgraceful, beloved, yea, highly disgraceful, and unworthy of your Christian profession, that such a thing should be heard of as that the most stedfast and ancient church of the Corinthians should, on account of one or two persons, engage in sedition against its presbyters.

verses.name: 1 Clement 47:8
verses.text: And this rumour has reached not only us, but those also who are unconnected with us; so that, through your infatuation, the name of the Lord is blasphemed, while danger is also brought upon yourselves.

verses.name: 1 Clement 48:1
verses.text: Chapter XLVIII.

verses.name: 1 Clement 48:2
verses.text: —Let Us Return to the Practice of Brotherly Love.

verses.name: 1 Clement 48:3
verses.text: Let us therefore, with all haste, put an end to this state of things; and let us fall down before the Lord, and beseech Him with tears, that He would mercifully be reconciled to us, and restore us to our former seemly and holy practice of brotherly love.

verses.name: 1 Clement 48:4
verses.text: For such conduct is the gate of righteousness, which is set open for the attainment of life, as it is written, "Open to me the gates of righteousness; I will go in by them, and will praise the Lord: this is the gate of the Lord: the righteous shall enter in by it".

verses.name: 1 Clement 48:5
verses.text: Although, therefore, many gates have been set open, yet this gate of righteousness is that gate in Christ by which blessed are all they that have entered in and have directed their way in holiness and righteousness, doing all things without disorder.

verses.name: 1 Clement 48:6
verses.text: Let a man be faithful: let him be powerful in the utterance of knowledge; let him be wise in judging of words; let him be pure in all his deeds; yet the more he seems to be superior to others in these respects, the more humble-minded ought he to be, and to seek the common good of all, and not merely his own advantage.

verses.name: 1 Clement 49:1
verses.text: Chapter XLIX—The Praise of Love.

verses.name: 1 Clement 49:2
verses.text: Let him who has love in Christ keep the commandments of Christ.

verses.name: 1 Clement 49:3
verses.text: Who can describe the blessed bond of the love of God? What man is able to tell the excellence of its beauty, as it ought to be told? The height to which love exalts is unspeakable.

verses.name: 1 Clement 49:4
verses.text: Love unites us to God.

verses.name: 1 Clement 49:5
verses.text: Love covers a multitude of sins.

verses.name: 1 Clement 49:6
verses.text: Love beareth all things, is long-suffering in all things.

verses.name: 1 Clement 49:7
verses.text: There is nothing base, nothing arrogant in love.

verses.name: 1 Clement 49:8
verses.text: Love admits of no schisms: love gives rise to no seditions: love does all things in harmony.

verses.name: 1 Clement 49:9
verses.text: By love have all the elect of God been made perfect; without love nothing is well-pleasing to God.

verses.name: 1 Clement 49:10
