verses.text: In love has the Lord taken us to Himself.

verses.name: 1 Clement 49:11
verses.text: On account of the love He bore us, Jesus Christ our Lord gave His blood for us by the will of God; His flesh for our flesh, and His soul for our souls.

verses.name: 1 Clement 50:1
verses.text: Chapter L.

verses.name: 1 Clement 50:2
verses.text: —Let Us Pray to Be Thought Worthy of Love.

verses.name: 1 Clement 50:3
verses.text: Ye see, beloved, how great and wonderful a thing is love, and that there is no declaring its perfection.

verses.name: 1 Clement 50:4
verses.text: Who is fit to be found in it, except such as God has vouchsafed to render so? Let us pray, therefore, and implore of His mercy, that we may live blameless in love, free from all human partialities for one above another.

verses.name: 1 Clement 50:5
verses.text: All the generations from Adam even unto this day have passed away; but those who, through the grace of God, have been made perfect in love, now possess a place among the godly, and shall be made manifest at the revelation of the kingdom of Christ.

verses.name: 1 Clement 50:6
verses.text: For it is written, "Enter into thy secret chambers for a little time, until my wrath and fury pass away; and I will remember a propitious day, and will raise you up out of your graves".

verses.name: 1 Clement 50:7
verses.text: Blessed are we, beloved, if we keep the commandments of God in the harmony of love; that so through love our sins may be forgiven us.

verses.name: 1 Clement 50:8
verses.text: For it is written, "Blessed are they whose transgressions are forgiven, and whose sins are covered.

verses.name: 1 Clement 50:9
verses.text: Blessed is the man whose sin the Lord will not impute to him, and in whose mouth there is no guile.

verses.name: 1 Clement 50:10
verses.text: This blessedness cometh upon those who have been chosen by God through Jesus Christ our Lord; to whom be glory for ever and ever, Amen.

verses.name: 1 Clement 51:1
verses.text: Chapter LI.

verses.name: 1 Clement 51:2
verses.text: —Let the Partakers in Strife Acknowledge Their Sins.

verses.name: 1 Clement 51:3
verses.text: Let us therefore implore forgiveness for all those transgressions which through any suggestion of the adversary we have committed.

verses.name: 1 Clement 51:4
verses.text: And these who have been the leaders of sedition and disagreement ought to have respect to the common hope.

verses.name: 1 Clement 51:5
verses.text: For such as live in fear and love would rather that they themselves than their neighbours should be involved in suffering.

verses.name: 1 Clement 51:6
verses.text: And they prefer to bear blame themselves, rather than that the concord which has been well and piously handed down to us should suffer.

verses.name: 1 Clement 51:7
verses.text: For it is better that a man should acknowledge his transgressions than that he should harden his heart, as the hearts of those were hardened who stirred up sedition against Moses the servant of God, and whose condemnation was made manifest unto all.

verses.name: 1 Clement 51:8
verses.text: For they went down alive into Hades, and death swallowed them up.

verses.name: 1 Clement 51:9
verses.text: Pharaoh with his army and all the princes of Egypt, and the chariots with their riders, were sunk in the depths of the Red Sea, and perished, for no other reason than that their foolish hearts were hardened, after so many signs and wonders had been wrought in the land of Egypt by Moses the servant of God.

verses.name: 1 Clement 52:1
verses.text: Chapter LII.

verses.name: 1 Clement 52:2
verses.text: —Such a Confession is Pleasing to God.

verses.name: 1 Clement 52:3
verses.text: The Lord, brethren, stands in need of nothing; and He desires nothing of any one except that confession be made to Him.

verses.name: 1 Clement 52:4
verses.text: For, says the elect David, "I will confess unto the Lord; and that will please Him more than a young bullock that hath horns and hoofs.

verses.name: 1 Clement 52:5
verses.text: Let the poor see it, and be glad".

verses.name: 1 Clement 52:6
verses.text: And again he saith, "Offer unto God the sacrifice of praise, and pay thy vows unto the Most High.

verses.name: 1 Clement 52:7
verses.text: And call upon me in the day of thy trouble: I will deliver thee, and thou shalt glorify me".

verses.name: 1 Clement 52:8
verses.text: For "the sacrifice of God is a broken spirit".

verses.name: 1 Clement 53:1
verses.text: Chapter LIII.

verses.name: 1 Clement 53:2
verses.text: —The Love of Moses Towards His People.

verses.name: 1 Clement 53:3
verses.text: Ye understand, beloved, ye understand well the sacred Scriptures, and ye have looked very earnestly into the oracles of God.

verses.name: 1 Clement 53:4
verses.text: Call then these things to your remembrance.

verses.name: 1 Clement 53:5
verses.text: When Moses went up into the mount, and abode there, with fasting and humiliation, forty days and forty nights, the Lord said unto him, "Moses, Moses, get thee down quickly from hence; for thy people whom thou didst bring out of the land of Egypt have committed iniquity.

verses.name: 1 Clement 53:6
verses.text: They have speedily departed from the way in which I commanded them to walk, and have made to themselves molten images".

verses.name: 1 Clement 53:7
verses.text: And the Lord said unto him, "I have spoken to thee once and again, saying, I have seen this people, and, behold, it is a stiff-necked people: let me destroy them, and blot out their name from under heaven; and I will make thee a great and wonderful nation, and one much more numerous than this".

verses.name: 1 Clement 53:8
verses.text: But Moses said, "Far be it from Thee, Lord: pardon the sin of this people; else blot me also out of the book of the living".

verses.name: 1 Clement 53:9
verses.text: O marvellous love! O insuperable perfection! The servant speaks freely to his Lord, and asks forgiveness for the people, or begs that he himself might perish along with them.

verses.name: 1 Clement 54:1
verses.text: Chapter LIV.

verses.name: 1 Clement 54:2
verses.text: —He Who is Full of Love Will Incur Every Loss, that Peace May Be Restored to the Church.

verses.name: 1 Clement 54:3
verses.text: Who then among you is noble-minded? who compassionate? who full of love? Let him declare, "If on my account sedition and disagreement and schisms have arisen, I will depart, I will go away whithersoever ye desire, and I will do whatever the majority commands; only let the flock of Christ live on terms of peace with the presbyters set over it".

verses.name: 1 Clement 54:4
verses.text: He that acts thus shall procure to himself great glory in the Lord; and every place will welcome him.

verses.name: 1 Clement 54:5
verses.text: For "the earth is the Lord's, and the fulness thereof".

verses.name: 1 Clement 54:6
verses.text: These things they who live a godly life that is never to be repented of, both have done and always will do.

verses.name: 1 Clement 55:1
verses.text: Chapter LV.

verses.name: 1 Clement 55:2
verses.text: —Examples of Such Love.

verses.name: 1 Clement 55:3
verses.text: To bring forward some examples from among the heathen: Many kings and princes, in times of pestilence, when they had been instructed by an oracle, have given themselves up to death, in order that by their own blood they might deliver their fellow-citizens from destruction.

verses.name: 1 Clement 55:4
verses.text: Many have gone forth from their own cities, that so sedition might be brought to an end within them.

verses.name: 1 Clement 55:5
verses.text: We know many among ourselves who have given themselves up to bonds, in order that they might ransom others.

verses.name: 1 Clement 55:6
verses.text: Many, too, have surrendered themselves to slavery, that with the price which they received for themselves, they might provide food for others.

verses.name: 1 Clement 55:7
verses.text: Many women also, being strengthened by the grace of God, have performed numerous manly exploits.

verses.name: 1 Clement 55:8
verses.text: The blessed Judith, when her city was besieged, asked of the elders permission to go forth into the camp of the strangers; and, exposing herself to danger, she went out for the love which she bare to her country and people then besieged; and the Lord delivered Holofernes into the hands of a woman.

verses.name: 1 Clement 55:9
verses.text: Esther also, being perfect in faith, exposed herself to no less danger, in order to deliver the twelve tribes of Israel from impending destruction.

verses.name: 1 Clement 55:10
verses.text: For with fasting and humiliation she entreated the everlasting God, who seeth all things; and He, perceiving the humility of her spirit, delivered the people for whose sake she had encountered peril.

verses.name: 1 Clement 56:1
verses.text: Chapter LVI.

verses.name: 1 Clement 56:2
verses.text: —Let Us Admonish and Correct One Another.

verses.name: 1 Clement 56:3
verses.text: Let us then also pray for those who have fallen into any sin, that meekness and humility may be given to them, so that they may submit, not unto us, but to the will of God.

verses.name: 1 Clement 56:4
verses.text: For in this way they shall secure a fruitful and perfect remembrance from us, with sympathy for them, both in our prayers to God, and our mention of them to the saints.

verses.name: 1 Clement 56:5
verses.text: Let us receive correction, beloved, on account of which no one should feel displeased.

verses.name: 1 Clement 56:6
verses.text: Those exhortations by which we admonish one another are both good in themselves, and highly profitable, for they tend to unite us to the will of God.

verses.name: 1 Clement 56:7
verses.text: For thus saith the holy Word: "The Lord hath severely chastened me, yet hath not given me over to death".

verses.name: 1 Clement 56:8
verses.text: "For whom the Lord loveth He chasteneth, and scourgeth every son whom He receiveth".

verses.name: 1 Clement 56:9
verses.text: "The righteous," saith it, "shall chasten me in mercy, and reprove me; but let not the oil of sinners make fat my head".

verses.name: 1 Clement 56:10
verses.text: And again he saith, "Blessed is the man whom the Lord reproveth, and reject not thou the warning of the Almighty.

verses.name: 1 Clement 56:11
verses.text: For He causes sorrow, and again restores to gladness; He woundeth, and His hands make whole.

verses.name: 1 Clement 56:12
verses.text: He shall deliver thee in six troubles, yea, in the seventh no evil shall touch thee.

verses.name: 1 Clement 56:13
verses.text: In famine He shall rescue thee from death, and in war He shall free thee from the power of the sword.

verses.name: 1 Clement 56:14
verses.text: From the scourge of the tongue will He hide thee, and thou shalt not fear when evil cometh.

verses.name: 1 Clement 56:15
verses.text: Thou shalt laugh at the unrighteous and the wicked, and shalt not be afraid of the beasts of the field.

verses.name: 1 Clement 56:16
verses.text: For the wild beasts shall be at peace with thee: then shalt thou know that thy house shall be in peace, and the habitation of thy tabernacle shall not fail.

verses.name: 1 Clement 56:17
verses.text: Thou shalt know also that thy seed shall be great, and thy children like the grass of the field.

verses.name: 1 Clement 56:18
verses.text: And thou shalt come to the grave like ripened corn which is reaped in its season, or like a heap of the threshing-floor which is gathered together at the proper time".

verses.name: 1 Clement 56:19
verses.text: Ye see, beloved, that "protection is afforded to those that are chastened of the Lord; for since God is good, He corrects us, that we may be admonished" by His holy chastisement.

verses.name: 1 Clement 57:1
verses.text: Chapter LVII.

verses.name: 1 Clement 57:2
verses.text: —Let the Authors of Sedition Submit Themselves.

verses.name: 1 Clement 57:3
verses.text: Ye therefore, who laid the foundation of this sedition, submit yourselves to the presbyters, and receive correction so as to repent, bending the knees of your hearts.

verses.name: 1 Clement 57:4
verses.text: Learn to be subject, laying aside the proud and arrogant self-confidence of your tongue.

verses.name: 1 Clement 57:5
verses.text: For it is better for you that ye should occupy a humble but honourable place in the flock of Christ, than that, being highly exalted, ye should be cast out from the hope of His people.

verses.name: 1 Clement 57:6
verses.text: For thus speaketh all-virtuous Wisdom: "Behold, I will bring forth to you the words of my Spirit, and I will teach you my speech.

verses.name: 1 Clement 57:7
verses.text: Since I called, and ye did not hear; I held forth my words, and ye regarded not, but set at naught my counsels, and yielded not at my reproofs; therefore I too will laugh at your destruction; yea, I will rejoice when ruin cometh upon you, and when sudden confusion overtakes you, when overturning presents itself like a tempest, or when tribulation and oppression fall upon you.

verses.name: 1 Clement 57:8
verses.text: For it shall come to pass, that when ye call upon me, I will not hear you; the wicked shall seek me, and they shall not find me.

verses.name: 1 Clement 57:9
verses.text: For they hated wisdom, and did not choose the fear of the Lord; nor would they listen to my counsels, but despised my reproofs.

verses.name: 1 Clement 57:10
verses.text: Wherefore they shall eat the fruits of their own way, and they shall be filled with their own ungodliness.

verses.name: 1 Clement 57:11
verses.text: …For, in punishment for the wrongs which they practised upon babes, shall they be slain, and inquiry will be death to the ungodly; but he that heareth me shall rest in hope and be undisturbed by the fear of any evil".

verses.name: 1 Clement 58:1
verses.text: Chapter LVIII.

verses.name: 1 Clement 58:2
verses.text: —Submission the Precursor of Salvation.

verses.name: 1 Clement 58:3
verses.text: Let us, therefore, flee from the warning threats pronounced by Wisdom on the disobedient, and yield submission to His all-holy and glorious name, that we may stay our trust upon the most hallowed name of His majesty.

verses.name: 1 Clement 58:4
verses.text: Receive our counsel, and ye shall be without repentance.

verses.name: 1 Clement 58:5
verses.text: For, as God liveth, and as the Lord Jesus Christ and the Holy Ghost live,—both the faith and hope of the elect, he who in lowliness of mind, with instant gentleness, and without repentance hath observed the ordinances and appointments given by God—the same shall obtain a place and name in the number of those who are being saved through Jesus Christ, through whom is glory to Him for ever and ever, Amen.

verses.name: 1 Clement 59:1
verses.text: Chapter LIX.

verses.name: 1 Clement 59:2
verses.text: —Warning Against Disobedience.

verses.name: 1 Clement 59:3
verses.text: Prayer.

verses.name: 1 Clement 59:4
verses.text: If, however, any shall disobey the words spoken by Him through us, let them know that they will involve themselves in transgression and serious danger; but we shall be innocent of this sin, and, instant in prayer and supplication, shall desire that the Creator of all preserve unbroken the computed number of His elect in the whole world through His beloved Son Jesus Christ, through whom He called us from darkness to light, from ignorance to knowledge of the glory of His name, our hope resting on Thy name which is primal cause of every creature,—having opened the eyes of our heart to the knowledge of Thee, who alone "dost rest highest among the highest, holy among the holy," who "layest low the insolence of the haughty," who "destroyest the calculations of the heathen," who "settest the low on high and bringest low the exalted;" who "makest rich and makest poor," who "killest and makest to live," only Benefactor of spirits and God of all flesh, who beholdest the depths, the eye-witness of human works, the help of those in danger, the Saviour of those in despair, the Creator and Guardian of every spirit, who multipliest nations upon earth, and from all madest choice of those who love Thee through Jesus Christ, Thy beloved Son, through whom Thou didst instruct, sanctify, honour us.

verses.name: 1 Clement 59:5
verses.text: We would have Thee, Lord, to prove our help and succour.

verses.name: 1 Clement 59:6
verses.text: Those of us in affliction save, on the lowly take pity; the fallen raise; upon those in need arise; the sick heal; the wandering ones of Thy people turn; fill the hungry; redeem those of us in bonds; raise up those that are weak; comfort the faint-hearted; let all the nations know that Thou art God alone and Jesus Christ Thy Son, and we are Thy people and the sheep of Thy pasture.

verses.name: 1 Clement 60:1
verses.text: Chapter LX.

verses.name: 1 Clement 60:2
verses.text: —Prayer Continued.

verses.name: 1 Clement 60:3
verses.text: Thou didst make to appear the enduring fabric of the world by the works of Thy hand; Thou, Lord, didst create the earth on which we dwell,—Thou, who art faithful in all generations, just in judgments, wonderful in strength and majesty, with wisdom creating and with understanding fixing the things which were made, who art good among them that are being saved and faithful among them whose trust is in Thee; O merciful and Compassionate One, forgive us our iniquities and offences and transgressions and trespasses.

verses.name: 1 Clement 60:4
verses.text: Reckon not every sin of Thy servants and handmaids, but Thou wilt purify us with the purification of Thy truth; and direct our steps that we may walk in holiness of heart and do what is good and well-pleasing in Thy sight and in the sight of our rulers.

verses.name: 1 Clement 60:5
verses.text: Yea, Lord, make Thy face to shine upon us for good in peace, that we may be shielded by Thy mighty hand and delivered from every sin by Thine uplifted arm, and deliver us from those who hate us wrongfully.

verses.name: 1 Clement 60:6
verses.text: Give concord and peace to us and all who dwell upon the earth, even as Thou gavest to our fathers, when they called upon Thee in faith and truth, submissive as we are to Thine almighty and all-excellent Name.

verses.name: 1 Clement 61:1
verses.text: Chapter LXI.

verses.name: 1 Clement 61:2
verses.text: —Prayer Continued—For Rulers and Governors.

verses.name: 1 Clement 61:3
verses.text: Conclusion.

verses.name: 1 Clement 61:4
verses.text: To our rulers and governors on the earth—to them Thou, Lord, gavest the power of the kingdom by Thy glorious and ineffable might, to the end that we may know the glory and honour given to them by Thee and be subject to them, in nought resisting Thy will; to them, Lord, give health, peace, concord, stability, that they may exercise the authority given to them without offence.

verses.name: 1 Clement 61:5
verses.text: For Thou, O heavenly Lord and King eternal, givest to the sons of men glory and honour and power over the things that are on the earth; do Thou, Lord, direct their counsel according to that which is good and well-pleasing in Thy sight, that, devoutly in peace and meekness exercising the power given them by Thee, they may find Thee propitious.

verses.name: 1 Clement 61:6
verses.text: O Thou, who only hast power to do these things and more abundant good with us, we praise Thee through the High Priest and Guardian of our souls Jesus Christ, through whom be glory and majesty to Thee both now and from generation to generation and for evermore, Amen.

verses.name: 1 Clement 62:1
verses.text: Chapter LXII.

verses.name: 1 Clement 62:2
verses.text: —Summary and Conclusory—Concerning Godliness.

verses.name: 1 Clement 62:3
verses.text: Concerning the things pertaining to our religious observance which are most profitable for a life of goodness to those who would pursue a godly and righteous course, we have written to you, men and brethren, at sufficient length.

verses.name: 1 Clement 62:4
verses.text: For concerning faith and repentance and true love and continence and soberness and patience, we have touched upon every passage, putting you in mind that you ought in righteousness and truth and long-suffering to be well-pleasing to Almighty God with holiness, being of one mind—not remembering evil—in love and peace with instant gentleness, even as also our fathers forementioned found favour by the humility of their thoughts towards the Father and God and Creator and all mankind.

verses.name: 1 Clement 62:5
verses.text: And of these things we put you in mind with the greater pleasure, since we were well assured that we were writing to men who were faithful and of highest repute and had peered into the oracles of the instruction of God.

verses.name: 1 Clement 63:1
verses.text: Chapter LXIII.

verses.name: 1 Clement 63:2
verses.text: —Hortatory, Letter Sent by Special Messengers.

verses.name: 1 Clement 63:3
verses.text: Right is it, therefore, to approach examples so good and so many, and submit the neck and fulfil the part of obedience, in order that, undisturbed by vain sedition, we may attain unto the goal set before us in truth wholly free from blame.

verses.name: 1 Clement 63:4
verses.text: Joy and gladness will ye afford us, if ye become obedient to the words written by us and through the Holy Spirit root out the lawless wrath of your jealousy according to the intercession which we have made for peace and unity in this letter.

verses.name: 1 Clement 63:5
verses.text: We have sent men faithful and discreet, whose conversation from youth to old age has been blameless amongst us,—the same shall be witnesses between you and us.

verses.name: 1 Clement 63:6
verses.text: This we have done, that ye may know that our whole concern has been and is that ye may be speedily at peace.

verses.name: 1 Clement 64:1
verses.text: Chapter LXIV.

verses.name: 1 Clement 64:2
verses.text: —Blessings Sought for All that Call Upon God.

verses.name: 1 Clement 64:3
verses.text: May God, who seeth all things, and who is the Ruler of all spirits and the Lord of all flesh—who chose our Lord Jesus Christ and us through Him to be a peculiar people—grant to every soul that calleth upon His glorious and holy name, faith, fear, peace, patience, long-suffering, self-control, purity, and sobriety, to the well-pleasing of His name, through our High Priest and Protector, Jesus Christ, by whom be to Him glory, and majesty, and power, and honour, both now and for evermore, Amen.

verses.name: 1 Clement 65:1
verses.text: Chapter LXV.

verses.name: 1 Clement 65:2
verses.text: —The Corinthians are Exhorted Speedily to Send Back Word that Peace Has Been Restored.

verses.name: 1 Clement 65:3
verses.text: The Benediction.

verses.name: 1 Clement 65:4
verses.text: Send back speedily to us in peace and with joy these our messengers to you: Claudius Ephebus and Valerius Bito, with Fortunatus; that they may the sooner announce to us the peace and harmony we so earnestly desire and long for among you, and that we may the more quickly rejoice over the good order re-established among you.

verses.name: 1 Clement 65:5
verses.text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you, and with all everywhere that are the called of God through Him, by whom be to Him glory, honour, power, majesty, and eternal dominion, from everlasting to everlasting, Amen.
